intro: Hieracium pilemotum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring a hairy stem and basal rosettes of leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, often with a distinctive central disk. Hieracium pilemotum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
